ygData.msgSnippet: Tucson takes his time and listens carefully to the hum.  He soon figures out that sonar was not going to work, nor was his radio communication device.  He

---347748201-6889124-1323663036=:41714
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Tucson takes his time and listens carefully to the hum.=C2=A0 He soon figur=
es out that sonar was not going to work, nor was his radio communication de=
vice.=C2=A0 He hoped that the others knew Morse Code, and begins to tap aud=
ibly on a stalagmite, with one claw, just enough to make sound, but no dama=
ge.
=C2=A0
In the code, he types.
=C2=A0
" Radio and sonar communication is=
 useless now.=C2=A0 Looks like we'll have to resort to more primative measu=
res.=C2=A0 Don't worry Big Convoy, I'm not going to bite off more than I ca=
n chew.=C2=A0 If anything, I'm taking my time and doing this carefully.=C2=
=A0 Patience is something I learned from my master.=C2=A0 Sometimes things =
can not be done too quickly, and must be done over a lapse of time.=C2=A0 A=
nd sometimes it's best to make little disturbance and to keep things as the=
y are found.=C2=A0=C2=A0 That's what we need to do.=C2=A0 I'll try my best =
not to break anything, "
=C2=A0
As he walks on, the tip of his wing catches=
 a sharp edge of a rock, and tears slightly.=C2=A0 He grunts in pain.
=C2=
=A0
" I should've been more careful."

Respect those as you wish to be resp=
ected.


________________________________
From: Super Cyclonus <supercyclon=
us@...>
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Sent: Sunday, December 11, 2011 5=
:43 PM
Subject: Re: Into the Teeth! (Tuscon)


=C2=A0 
> <OLD>
>
> Tucson l=
ooks back to Big Convoy as determined as ever with a nod. He was not
> abou=
t to quit now, or at any time.
>
> " I'm sure. "
>
> Tucson states as he ge=
ts back into robot mode.
>
> " I've seen something similar to this in train=
ing with Master Yoketron. It
> was one of his more difficult excercises. It=
 taught me further into the art
> of balance and dexterity, simply by using=
 my skills at a more conscious
> level. I know we'll need that now. "
>
> H=
e slowly walks a step further in and looks around.
>
> " I can go first and=
 map a safe route for the rest of you. Just follow my
> lead and a scratch =
mark I will leave on various surfaces to show you the
> safest way through.=
"
>
> He finds his first step and tests the ground, before marking it for t=
he rest
> of the team. Three claw marks drawn in a symbol makes the way to =
safer
> grounds.
>
> " All right, Mach Kick's right, we better be on our wa=
y. Careful, just
> follow me and you'll be fine."

<NEW>

BIG CONVOY nodded=
, "But don't let over confidence get the better of
you. Just because you ca=
n fly doen't mean you can't be brought down."

Hefting his weapon CONVOY mo=
tioned for BREAK and MACK KICK to follow
him as he followed TUSCON. "Single=
 file now and by the numbers, we
don't have a second time for this one."

T=
he others nodded as they fell in step and began to move.

The ground for TU=
SCON quickly sloped down as once again he made his
way. As it was once befo=
re all communication systems were down and
even IFF sensors were muffled as=
 parts of them required a low level
form of radio transmission, if only pas=
sive a one. There was no way to
transmit data on radio wave.

As he moved t=
he cave was lit by glowing phosphorescent rocks of some
sort sitting in the=
 roof of the cave, their lights creating an odd
scintillating color as they=
 bounced off some of the more reflective
surfaces of other stones.

Ahead o=
f him the cave tunnel he was in continued to drop and oddly
enough his sens=
or range was actually getting smaller and shorter as he
moved. His senses w=
orked just fine, but radar and sonar were getting
shorter and shorter pings=
 as if something was interfering.

However he was beginning to pick up a lo=
w level hum.

(TAG)

- Preston
